channel.title: The Golden Age
channel.description: Old Time Radio programs for your listening pleasure. Frank
channel.itunes:subtitle: Welcome, pull up an ear.
channel.itunes:author: Frank Slabinak
channel.itunes:summary: Old Time Radio programs for your listening pleasure. Frank

item.title: Tale of The Tattoo
item.description:
Tale of The Tattoo (trailer)
2010

Trailer (teaser) for the documentary feature film Tale of The Tattoo.

Still in production and tattoo's are still needed for the film.

http://www.handbuiltfilms.com

Enjoy,
Frank
item.dc:creator: Frank Slabinak
item.itunes:summary: Tale of The Tattoo (trailer) 2010 Trailer (teaser) for the documentary feature film Tale of The Tattoo. Still in production and tattoo's are still needed for the film.http://www.handbuiltfilms.com Enjoy, Frank

item.title: Open Road Radio
item.description:
Open Road Radio
January 16, 2010

Video broadcast of the radio show "Open Road Radio"

They are looking to stream the radio show, so this was a test run.

http://www.openroadradio.com

http://www.handbuiltfilms.com

Enjoy,
Frank

item.description:
Commercial
March 1, 2009

Commercial for the March 1st Movie Memorabilia Show and Film Festival starring Michelle Shields

http://www.moviememorabiliashow.com

Enjoy,
Frank

item.title: Let's Talk Hollywood
item.description:
Untitled
July 25, 1948 - NBC

Celebrities answer questions sent in by listeners. The first question is, "Name the street associated with each of these Hollywood film characters." Starring George Murphy (mc), Erskine Johnson, Eddie Bracken, Celeste Holm, Francis X. Bushman, L. A. Speed Riggs, Hy Averback (announcer), Basil Ruysdael (announcer).

Enjoy,
Frank
item.dc:creator: Frank Slabinak
item.itunes:summary: Untitled July 25, 1948 - NBC Celebrities answer questions sent in by listeners. The first question is, "Name the street associated with each of these Hollywood film characters." Starring George Murphy (mc), Erskine Johnson, Eddie Bracken, Celeste Holm, Francis X. Bushman, L. A. Speed Riggs, Hy Averback (announcer), Basil Ruysdael (announcer). Enjoy, Frank

item.title: Let's Have Fun
item.description:
1st Program
October 22, 1935 - CBS

A great musical about a "modern" crooner who takes a time machine trip back to the days of Cleopatra. Starring Rodgers and Hart (composers), Helen Morgan, Ken Murray, Romney Brent, Freddie Rich and His Orchestra, The King's Men and The Queen's Maids.

Enjoy,
Frank
item.dc:creator: Frank Slabinak

item.title: Behind The Scenes with Sofiya
item.description:
Sofiya's Video Blog
2008

A short time ago you saw the commercial for the December 7th Movie Memorabilia Show with Sofiya Smirnova. In this video segment, Sofiya talks about making the commercial.

Enjoy,
Frank
item.dc:creator: Frank Slabinak
item.itunes:summary: Sofiya's Video Blog 2008 A short time ago you saw the commercial for the December 7th Movie Memorabilia Show with Sofiya Smirnova. In this video segment, Sofiya talks about making the commercial. Enjoy, Frank

item.title: Movie Memorabilia Show
item.description:
Radio commercial for the September 7th Movie Memorabilia Show featuring a live radio broadcast by Open Road Radio and an appearence by Sofiya Smirnova.

Sofiya will meet and greet fans along with talking about her latest film "Coventry Lanes" plus what it was like to work on the new Batman film, "The Dark Knight".

http://www.moviememorabiliashow.com
http://www.openroadradio.com
http://www.sofiya-smirnova.com
item.dc:creator: Frank Slabinak
